DataElement.preferredName: Induction Chemotherapy Complete Prior To Randomization Stratification Factors Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol based on whether or not a first choice of a synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment for a particular type of cancer.was previously used.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Induction Therapy Chemotherapy Complete Prior To Randomization Stratification Factors
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The first choice of treatment for a particular type of cancer._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion._Earlier in time or order._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment._Selected pre-treatment factors by which patients are segregated to assure equal balance of these factors before randomization to the intervention arms of a clinical protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The first choice of treatment for a particular type of cancer.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Concepts.definition: The first choice of treatment for a particular type of cancer.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

Property.preferredName: Complete Prior To Randomization Stratification Factors

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
